etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in William Hutchinson (1732–1814), topographer. From sun + -wise

definitions: In the direction of the apparent daily movement of the sun (often considered as lucky or auspicious); from east to west.

notes.text: In the northern hemisphere, the sun appears to move in an arc from left to right across the sky (and hence sunwise is often synonymous with clockwise), and in the southern hemisphere, in an arc from right to left.

definitions: Moving or turning in the direction of the apparent daily movement of the sun; designating such a movement or direction.
